{{Infobox pageant titleholder | name=StefanÃ­a FernÃ¡ndez | image = STEFANIA2.JPG | caption=[[Miss Universe 2009]] | birth_place= [[MÃ©rida, MÃ©rida|MÃ©rida]], [[MÃ©rida (state)|MÃ©rida State]], [[Venezuela]] | birth_date= {{Birth date and age|mf=yes|1990|9|04}} | birth_name= StefanÃ­a FernÃ¡ndez Krupij | nationalcompetition=[[Miss Universe 2009]] (Winner)
[[Miss Venezuela 2008]] (Winner) | height={{height|m=1.78|precision=0}} | eye_color= [[Brown eyes|Brown]] | hair_color= [[Brown hair#Varieties of brown hair|Brown]] }} '''StefanÃ­a FernÃ¡ndez Krupij''' (born September 4, 1990) is a [[Venezuela]]n [[beauty pageant]] titleholder who won the [[Miss Venezuela 2008]] and [[Miss Universe 2009]] titles. She earned a [[Guinness record]] by being the first Miss Universe winner who was crowned by a [[compatriot]].[http://community.guinnessworldrecords.com/_Most-consecutive-wins-of-the-Miss-Universe-contest/blog/870434/7691.html http://community.guinnessworldrecords.com/_Most-consecutive-wins-of-the-Miss-Universe-contest/blog/870434/7691.html]{{Cite news | url = http://www.eluniversal.com/2009/08/23/til_ava_stefania-fernandez-g_23A2651327.shtml | title = StefanÃ­a FernÃ¡ndez gana el Miss Universo y Venezuela repite | work = El Universal | location = Caracas, Venezuela | language = Spanish | author = Norma JimÃ©nez Montealegre | date = August 23, 2009 | accessdate = 2009-08-24 }} {{Dead link|date=September 2010|bot=H3llBot}} ==Personal life== FernÃ¡ndez is of [[Ukrainian people|Ukrainian]], [[Russian people|Russian]], [[Polish people|Polish]] and [[Galician people|Spanish (Galician)]] origin. Her mother is Nadia Krupij Holojad, whose Ukrainian father immigrated from the [[Soviet Union]] during the period of [[Communist Party of the Soviet Union|Communist rule]].[http://www.elcomercio.com/noticiaEC.asp?id_noticia=300163&id_seccion=329 ]{{Dead link|date=August 2010}} ==Miss Venezuela 2008== FernÃ¡ndez won the [[Miss Venezuela 2008]] title in a pageant held in [[Caracas]] on September 10, 2008. She was crowned by the outgoing titleholder, [[Dayana Mendoza]], [[Miss Venezuela 2007]] and [[Miss Universe 2008]].{{Cite web|publisher=El Universal|title=Miss Trujillo StefanÃ­a FernÃ¡ndez fue electa Miss Venezuela. 2008|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/2008/09/10/til_ava_miss-trujillo-stefan_10A1979003.shtml|accessdate=2008-09-10}} FernÃ¡ndez also won the ''"Miss Elegance"'', ''"Best Body"'', and ''"Best Face"'', titles.{{Cite web|publisher=Cadena Global|title=Miss Trujillo acaparÃ³ los premios en "La Gala de la Belleza"|url=http://www.cadenaglobal.com/noticias/default.asp?Not=188694&Sec=1|accessdate=2008-08-31}} {{Dead link|date=September 2010|bot=H3llBot}} She became the second Miss [[Trujillo (state)|Trujillo]] to win that title since the [[Miss Venezuela]] pageant first began in 1952 and also the second Miss Trujillo to win [[Miss Universe]]. The first was [[BÃ¡rbara Palacios]], [[Miss Venezuela 1986]] and [[Miss Universe 1986]]. Miss Universe 2008, [[Dayana Mendoza]] (also from Venezuela), crowned her as [[Miss Universe 2009]] on August 23, 2009, in [[Nassau, Bahamas]]. This marked the first time in Miss Universe history the same country won the crown in consecutive years.{{Cite web|url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/southamerica/venezuela/6079367/Venezuelan-Stefania-Fernandez-crowned-Miss-Universe.html|title=Venezuelan Stefania Fernandez crowned Miss Universe|date=2009-08-24|work=The Telegraph|accessdate=2009-08-25}} Her prize package included cash; a year contract promoting Miss Universe; world travel; a rent-free, prestigious [[New York City|New York]] luxury apartment; a gift bag stuffed with designer shoes, dresses, and beauty products; a US$100,000 [[stipend]] for a two-year course at the [[New York Film Academy]]; and free access to famous fashion houses and beauty parlors. FernÃ¡ndez intends to spend her year-long reign traveling the world to lecture on humanitarian issues and to promote education regarding [[HIV]]/[[AIDS]].[http://www.missuniverse.com/news/view/44 MISS UNIVERSE 2009 PRIZES ] ==Miss Universe 2009== [[Image:Stefaniapng.jpg|thumb|150px|StefanÃ­a during a Fashion show in Caracas, Venezuela]] After her crowning, FernÃ¡ndez was interviewed by [[CNN en EspaÃ±ol]], [[Fox News]], [[EFE]] agency (Spain), the [[Associated Press]], [[Univision]], [[Reuters]], RTN ([[Ukraine]]), [[Televisa]] ([[Mexico]]), [[VenevisiÃ³n]] (Venezuela), [[Caracol TelevisiÃ³n]] (Colombia), La Mega, Telemetro ([[Panama]]), MUN2, [[Televen]] (Venezuela), [[RCN TV]] ([[Colombia]]), [[Promar TV]], [[GlobovisiÃ³n]] (Venezuela), [[Telemundo]], Telecentro, Venevision Plus, Gem FM ([[Indonesia]]), ''[[The Wendy Williams Show]]'', [[NBC]]'s ''[[Today (NBC program)|Today]]'', ''[[Fox & Friends]]'', ''[[Don Francisco (television host)|Don Francisco]] Presenta'', ''[[El Gordo y la Flaca]]'', and others. Her arrival to Venezuela was transmitted by Venezuelan television; she had a homage in ''Super Sabado Sensacional'' during five hour special on VenevisiÃ³n (Venezuela's main TV network). FernÃ¡ndez received a [[Guinness record]] for being the first contestant to Miss Universe which is crowned by a compatriot (Dayana Mendoza, Miss Universe 2008).[[:es:StefanÃ­a FernÃ¡ndez]] The [[President of Venezuela]], [[Hugo ChÃ¡vez]], congratulated FernÃ¡ndez, and he gave her his support against her campaign against [[AIDS]]. He also gave his government's support .[http://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5jAM6OABv7lnvlR24qUe7vzTXKPWQ ChÃ¡vez ofreciÃ³ su apoyo a Miss Universo, la venezolana StefanÃ­a FernÃ¡ndez] In October, she traveled to [[Jakarta]], [[Bandung]][http://www.antara.co.id/en/news/1255274715/miss-universe-plays-angklung-in-bandung Miss Universe plays Angklung in Bandung] and [[Medan]],[http://www.medanku.com/miss-universe/ http://www.medanku.com/miss-universe/] in [[Indonesia]], where she crowned the Indonesian representative for the [[Miss Universe 2010]] pageant.[http://www.missuniverse.com/events/index/2009/10/about Miss Universe Calendar of Events] In November, she traveled again to Indonesia, specifically to the [[Bali]] island, when she filmed a commercial of vitamins. On her return to New York, she was in a press conference about [[HIV]], in which she appeared with [[Ban Ki-moon]], the [[Secretary-General of the United Nations|Secretary-General]] of the [[United Nations]], and with recognized Venezuelan fashion designer [[Carolina Herrera (fashion designer)|Carolina Herrera]]. On November 5, 2009, she served as a presenter at the [[Latin Grammy Awards]] in [[Las Vegas metropolitan area|Las Vegas]], [[United States]], sharing with [[Puerto Rico|Puerto Rican]] salsa singer [[VÃ­ctor Manuelle]]. At her second presentation in Venezuela, specifically in the Plaza de Toros Monumental de [[Maracaibo]], where there was a crowd of 15,000 people, they gave a recognition (Orchid Award) to FernÃ¡ndez at Orchid Festival of Chinita Fair. She also traveled to [[Cannes]], [[France]], on December 9, 2009, for the Five Star Diamond awards, with [[Miss USA]] [[Kristen Dalton (Miss USA)|Kristen Dalton]], and to [[Willemstad]], [[CuraÃ§ao]], [[Netherlands]], and [[Barquisimeto]], Venezuela, as well, in early January 2010, for the ProcesiÃ³n de la Divina Pastora (Procession of the Holy Shepherdess).[http://www.missuniverse.com/galleries/view/1203 http://www.missuniverse.com/galleries/view/1203] FernÃ¡ndez traveled to [[Puerto Rico]] in February 2010 to host ''LevÃ¡ntate'', a [[Telemundo]] TV show;[http://www.elexpresso.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=5262:miss-universo-anima-levantate&catid=26:farula&Itemid=34 Stefania in Puerto Rico] then traveled to New York, where she appeared on the ''[[Oprah Winfrey Show]]''.[http://www.oprah.com/oprahshow/Beauty-Secrets-from-Norway-Venezuela-and-the-Philippines-Video/topic/oprahshow http://www.oprah.com/oprahshow/Beauty-Secrets-from-Norway-Venezuela-and-the-Philippines-Video/topic/oprahshow] In September, March, and April, she traveled to [[Moscow]], [[SÃ£o Paulo]], [[Mumbai]], [[Nassau, Bahamas|Nassau]], [[Caracas]], and [[Prague]], where she crowned the respective representatives of those countries for the [[Miss Universe 2010]] pageant.[http://www.missuniverse.com/events/index/2010/3/pageant http://www.missuniverse.com/events/index/2010/3/pageant] She then flew to Colombia (she was invited to promote the [[Kimberly-Clark]] brand), Panama (where she served as a presenter for [[Sony]]), and to Puerto Rico again, for the [[Puerto Rico Open]].[http://www.hectorjoaquin.com/2010/03/stefanias-tour-miss-universe-runs-world.html http://www.hectorjoaquin.com/2010/03/stefanias-tour-miss-universe-runs-world.html] In May, FernÃ¡ndez traveled to RepÃºblica Dominicana Fashion Week in the [[Dominican Republic]]. Shortly thereafter, FernÃ¡ndez was named in the 50 Most Beautiful People list by ''[[People en EspaÃ±ol]]''.{{Cite web|url=http://www.peopleenespanol.com/pespanol/galleries/0,22491,1960327_1984970_11,00.html |title=STEFANÃA FERNÃNDEZ : LAS BELLAS : Los 50 MÃ¡s Bellos 2010 | page=11 | work=People en EspaÃ±ol |date=2010-04-26 |accessdate=2010-08-18}} On April 29, 2010, FernÃ¡ndez served as a presenter at [[Billboard|Latin Billboard Music Award]] in Puerto Rico.{{Cite web|url=http://www.zimbio.com/Miss+Universe/articles/imMzZSmRJFd/Stefania+Fernandez+attends+2010+Billboard |title=Stefania Fernandez attends the 2010 Billboard Latin Music Awards in Puerto Rico, Apr 29, 2010 - Miss Universe |publisher=Zimbio |date=2010-04-29 |accessdate=2010-08-18}} In March, 2010, Stefania became the official face of [[Avon Products]]{{Cite web|url=http://www.youtube.com/user/OfficialMissUniverse#p/u/12/dhqX11aWUDY |title=Kanaal van OfficialMissUniverse |publisher=YouTube |date= |accessdate=2010-08-18}} During her reign, FernÃ¡ndez traveled to [[Indonesia]], [[CuraÃ§ao]], [[Venezuela]], [[France]], [[Puerto Rico]], [[Russia]], [[Colombia]], [[Panama]], the [[Czech Republic]], the [[Bahamas]], [[Mexico]], the [[Dominican Republic]], [[Brazil]], [[India]], [[Argentina]], [[Spain]], [[Rwanda]], and [[Ecuador]]; in addition to numerous trips around the United States.{{Cite web|author=Site by: ILS |url=http://www.missuniverse.com/events/index/2010/7/pageant |title=Events |publisher=Miss Universe |date= |accessdate=2010-08-18}} [[File:Flag of Venezuela 1930-2006.svg|thumb|[[File:FIAV historical.svg|23x15px]] 7-star Flag of Venezuela, in use 1930â2006.]] On August 23, 2010, FernÃ¡ndez passed her crown to [[Ximena Navarrete]], Miss Mexico. During her final catwalk, she unveiled a [[Flag of Venezuela|Venezuelan flag]] with only seven stars. Venezuelan president [[Hugo ChÃ¡vez]] had ordered the flag changed from seven to eight stars in 2006. The display of the old flag was seen by [[Investor's Business Daily]] as a protest against the new policies of ChÃ¡vez.{{Cite news|url=http://www.investors.com/NewsAndAnalysis/Article/545008/201008251856/The-Killing-Fields-Of-Caracas.aspx |title=The Killing Fields Of Caracas |date=August 25, 2010 |publisher=Investors Business Daily}} ==Titles== * [[Miss Universe 2009|Miss Universe]] (2009) * [[Miss Venezuela 2008|Miss Venezuela]] (2008) * [[Miss Venezuela 2008|Miss Trujillo]] (2008) ==Awards== *2009: [[Guinness
